oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: WSM Variety Award Presentation - 1949-06-01 (copy) - Part 4
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: WSM program aimed at George Rosen of Variety magazine to celebrate winning the 1948 Variety Award for 'How To Run A Radio Station'. Part four of four, this part concludes the section on the Grand Ole Opry and concludes the program. This disc is a duplicate of TR001247_2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Red Foley; Bradley Kincaid; Rod Brasfield; Robert Lunn; Wally Fowler; Oak Ridge Quartet; Little Jimmy Dickens; George Morgan; Hank Williams
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Announcer talks about Opry stars' record sales -- Blues In My Heart (excerpt) (Red Foley) -- Announcer talks about Opry stars' record sales -- Footprints In The Snow (excerpt) (Bradley Kincaid) -- Announcer talks -- Comedy routine (excerpt) (Rod Brasfield, Red Foley) -- Outline of Opry talent personal appearances -- Talking Blues (excerpt) (Robert Lunn) -- Announcer talks about Robert Lunn -- Kentucky Waltz (excerpt) (Bill Monroe) -- Announcer talks about Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys -- Outline of Opry box office sales -- Announcer talks about Wally Fowler and his Oak Ridge Quartet -- Dem Bones (excerpt) (Wally Fowler and his Oak Ridge Quartet) -- Announcer talks about box office breakdowns -- Announcer talks about bakery opening in Lafayette, LA -- Take An Old Cold Tater (And Wait) (excerpt) (Little Jimmy Dickens) -- Announcer talks about Little Jimmy Dickens -- Candy Kisses (excerpt) (George Morgan) -- Announcer talks about George Morgan -- Lovesick Blues (excerpt) (Hank Williams) -- Announcer talks about WSM -- Tennessee Saturday Night (excerpt) (Red Foley) -- Announcer talks about WSM talent -- Outline of WSM programs -- Announcer closing statement -- Closing theme -- Announcer reads credits
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Foley, Red, 1910-1968; Kincaid, Bradley; Brasfield, Rod; Lunn, Robert; Monroe, Bill, 1911-1996; Fowler, Wally; Oak Ridge Quartet; Dickens, Little Jimmy, 1920-; Morgan, George, 1925-1975; Williams, Hank, 1923-1953; Stewart, Tom (WSM radio station); Stapp, Jack, 1912-1980; Stone, Harry, 1898-1968
